title: Row over abuse against PM Modi: BJP-Congress workers clash in Patna — Watch video
content: A clash erupted in Patna between Bharatiya Janata Party and Congress workers. This followed a protest by the BJP against alleged abuses directed at Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his mother. The abuses reportedly occurred during a rally in Darbhanga. Video evidence circulated, sparking outrage and condemnation from various political figures. Nitish Kumar also criticized the incident.

title: How this Bengaluru panipuri seller’s dowry demands led to his techie wife's death
content: Praveen, a former software engineer turned panipuri seller in Bengaluru, has been arrested for allegedly driving his 27-year-old wife, Shilpa, to suicide. Shilpa's mother accused Praveen and his mother of repeated dowry harassment, demanding additional money for his business even after an initial large sum was provided. The investigation is ongoing following Shilpa's death at her home.

title: Amid Trump’s tariffs, India buys more US oil - competitive prices at play
content: Indian refiners are increasing their purchases of US crude oil in August due to competitive pricing, potentially reducing the trade imbalance with the US amidst diplomatic tensions. Despite US tariffs, India remains committed to its strategic autonomy in procuring Russian crude, with plans to further increase Russian oil imports in September.

title: Bronco test: Rohit Sharma to report to BCCI's CoE on Sept 13; undergo fitness tests
content: Rohit Sharma, India's ODI captain, is set to undergo fitness assessments at the BCCI's Centre of Excellence in Bengaluru starting September 13, including the newly-introduced Bronco Test. He'll also practice there to prepare for the Australia white-ball tour in November.

title: Protest at Microsoft: Company fires 4 employees; workers received voicemails
content: Microsoft has fired four employees, including Nisreen Jardat and Julius Shan, after a sit-in protest at President Brad Smith's office. The protest, organized by No Azure for Apartheid, demanded Microsoft end its business ties with Israel and provide reparations to Palestine.

title: ‘Won’t bow’: Piyush Goyal’s message amid US tariffs; calls for self-reliance
content: Piyush Goyal says India will prioritize self-respect in trade talks. India is ready for free trade agreements, but not at the cost of national pride. The iron ore and steel industry aims to export 50 million tonnes of steel. The government will support industries affected by tariffs. The GST Council will meet soon to boost domestic demand.

title: Israel's ouster from Mumbai event splits Indian scientists
content: A controversy has erupted within India's scientific community following the International Olympiad on Astronomy and Astrophysics (IOAA) in Mumbai. Accusations have surfaced against faculty members for allegedly orchestrating a resolution to suspend Israel's participation due to the ongoing conflict in Gaza.

title: India's education cost: How much are families paying for fees, books, coaching?
content: A national survey by the NSS reveals that rural students in India spend significantly less on school education due to higher reliance on government schools, where fees are minimal or waived. The average annual expenditure in government schools is Rs 2,863, compared to Rs 25,002 in non-government institutions. Urban households spend more on course fees and coaching. The report also highlights regional cost disparities and limited financial support through scholarships, with 95% of students depending on family funding.

title: 'Not the smartest': Oracle founder's candid take on Bill Gates; likens him to Rockefeller
content: Larry Ellison lauded Bill Gates' relentless drive, comparing him to John D. Rockefeller. Despite acknowledging others might be smarter, Ellison emphasized Gates' unmatched focus and endurance. He highlighted Gates' pivotal role in Microsoft's success, noting his 'utterly relentless' nature. The Oracle founder's remarks underscore Gates' reputation as a powerhouse, capable of dominating through execution.

title: 'Already registered': R Ashwin signs up for overseas cricket franchise league
content: Ravichandran Ashwin, after retiring from the IPL with 187 wickets, has announced his intention to play in overseas franchise leagues. He has already registered for one league, seeking to enjoy cricket without pressure and recapture the joy of street cricket on the global stage.

title: Minneapolis shooting: Musk slams CNN for not mentioning Robin Westman was 'trans'
content: Musk’s commentary reflects his long-running hostility to what he calls “woke ideology.” Over the years, he has mocked pronoun use, derided protections for trans people, and pledged to oppose gender-affirming care for minors. His position has often sparked criticism from activists and employees alike, but he has remained defiant, presenting himself as a defender of “common sense” against progressive overreach.

title: 'Using our dollars for Russian oil': Trump aide takes 'laundromat' jibe at India again
content: Peter Navarro has accused India of funding Russia's war in Ukraine by purchasing discounted Russian crude oil, leading to increased tariffs on Indian imports by the US. Navarro claims India's refining of Russian oil benefits Moscow and undermines its partnership with the US.

title: ‘Not about line count’: Ex-GitHub CEO on AI; explains what really defines coding worth
content: Former GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke supports Microsoft's AI integration policy, where employee evaluations will include AI tool usage. Dohmke emphasizes cultural alignment and continuous learning over mere code generation metrics. He draws parallels to GitHub's mandatory platform usage, highlighting the importance of AI proficiency for competitive advantage. The focus is on meaningful conversations about AI adoption, reflecting a growth-oriented culture.

title: Unseen video: Harbhajan Singh nearly punched Sreesanth in IPL 2008 - Watch
content: Lalit Modi's recent revelation on a podcast has brought the infamous Harbhajan Singh-Sreesanth "slap-gate" incident from the inaugural IPL season in 2008 back into the spotlight. Modi claimed to possess unseen footage of the altercation, which resulted in Harbhajan's suspension and sparked significant controversy. The resurfacing of this incident reminded fans of the fiery early years of the league.

title: Hamburgini shuts down: Court orders liquidation after food poisoning scandal
content: Hamburgini, a once-thriving Saudi fast-food chain, has declared bankruptcy following a devastating 2024 food poisoning incident that left over 70 injured and one dead. The Riyadh Commercial Court has ordered liquidation of its parent company, Food Basics Trading. Once operating 57 branches nationwide, Hamburgini’s rapid downfall highlights the lasting impact of reputational crises on business survival.

title: 39-yr-old cardiac surgeon dies of heart attack: CMC Vellore doc lists top causes of heart risk
content: A young cardiac surgeon's sudden death from a heart attack has sparked concerns about the well-being of healthcare professionals. Doctors face immense pressure, long hours, and unhealthy lifestyles, increasing their risk of heart attacks. Experts emphasize the importance of preventive care, stress management, and healthy habits for doctors to protect their heart health.

title: UP dowry case: Woman forced to drink acid, dies after 17 days
content: A 23-year-old woman from Amroha, Gulfiza, tragically died after being allegedly forced to drink acid by her in-laws due to dowry demands of Rs 10 lakh and a car. She battled for her life for 17 days following the horrific incident on August 11.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the outlook for August 29?
content: Gold futures on MCX are trading steadily near ₹1,02,150, signaling continued upward momentum. Jateen Trivedi of LKP Securities suggests a 'buy on dips' strategy for investors. Intraday traders can consider buying near ₹1,01,850, with a stop-loss at ₹1,01,450. Technical indicators, including moving averages and MACD, confirm bullish strength, though the RSI indicates near overbought conditions, advising caution.

title: Starship lands in ocean: Reusable rocket milestone reached with historic splashdown
content: SpaceX's Starship S37 successfully completed a suborbital test flight, culminating in a controlled ocean landing. This tenth test flight validated critical upgrades like reinforced heat shields and a satellite deployment system. The mission demonstrated the feasibility of reusable rocket technology, marking a significant step towards reducing space travel costs and enabling future lunar and Martian missions.

title: Maratha quota protest: Mumbai on edge; traffic chokes CSMT, buses stuck for hours
content: Mumbai braces for traffic disruptions as Maratha quota activist Manoj Jarange Patil initiates an indefinite hunger strike at Azad Maidan today. Traffic police have announced road closures, including Panvel–Sion Road and Eastern Freeway, starting 6 am. Commuters are urged to avoid CST and surrounding areas due to anticipated congestion.

title: Jerry Jones shifts tone: From ‘I love you’ to trade talk
content: Dallas Cowboys traded Micah Parsons to Green Bay Packers. This move frees up 19 million dollars. Cowboys now have 42 million dollars in cap space for 2025. This allows them to sign other players. They can extend contracts of DaRon Bland and Tyler Smith. Jerry Jones mentioned Parsons could bring resources in a trade.

title: Bullet train & beyond: PM Modi's first visit to Japan in 7 years; what to expect?
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has arrived in Japan for a two-day visit, commencing with summit talks with Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba. Discussions will encompass strengthening developmental cooperation, reviewing progress across various sectors, and addressing regional and global issues. Focus areas include promoting a free and open Indo-Pacific, boosting defense and security cooperation, and launching an economic security initiative.

title: Urjit Patel named IMF executive director; to serve three-year term
content: Dr. Urjit Patel, former RBI governor, has been appointed as Executive Director at the International Monetary Fund for a three-year term, following central government approval. Patel previously served as the 24th RBI governor and also held the position of deputy governor, overseeing key areas such as monetary policy and economic research.

title: CBSE class 10, 12 admission update: Registration ends Aug 31
content: CBSE has set August 31, 2025, as the final date for Class 10 and 12 direct admissions and subject changes for the 2025-26 session. Schools must send records to CBSE Regional Offices by September 2, with approvals expected by September 15. Exceptions exist for government service transfers, requiring document submission within two days via the Harkara system.

title: Watch: Ukraine's 'largest' Navy ship hit by Russian drone; one killed, several missing
content: Russia escalated attacks on Ukraine, sinking the reconnaissance ship Simferopol in the Danube River delta, resulting in a crew member's death. Simultaneously, a major drone and missile attack on Kyiv killed at least 21 people, including children, and damaged numerous buildings. The UN Security Council will convene an emergency meeting to address the situation.

title: ‘Draconian tariffs’: Chris Wood sees $55-6bn hit for India
content: US tariffs on Indian goods, including penalties for Russian oil, could cost India $55-60 billion, impacting textiles, footwear, and jewelry sectors, according to Jefferies' Chris Wood. He believes the tariffs are triggered by Trump's frustration at being exclusion from India-Pakistan mediation and irritation over the Ukraine conflict.

title: Another cloudburst in Uttarakhand: Many families feared trapped in Rudraprayag
content: Cloudbursts struck Uttarakhand's Rudraprayag and Chamoli districts on Thursday night, trapping families and causing injuries. Debris flows blocked areas, prompting urgent rescue operations. Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami is overseeing relief efforts and coordinating with officials. This is the second cloudburst to hit the region this week, following earlier damage in Chamoli.

title: Bronco Test: 'It is introduced to keep Rohit out', ex-cricketer claims
content: Manoj Tiwary, former Indian cricketer, suggests the newly introduced Bronco Test in Indian cricket might be a strategy to exclude Rohit Sharma from the team, especially with the 2027 World Cup on the horizon. He questions the timing of this endurance-focused test, contrasting it with previous instances where fitness benchmarks seemingly sidelined senior players like Gambhir and Sehwag.

title: ‘Give Maratha quota or shoot us’: Manoj Jarange supporter challenges government
content: Maratha quota protesters, led by activist Manoj Jarange, have converged in Mumbai, demanding reservation under the OBC category. Farmer Maruti Patil expressed the community's desperation, stating they'd rather be shot than live without reservation.

title: Gujarat man rapes sister twice at knifepoint, brands her with bidi
content: In a shocking incident near Talaja, Bhavnagar, a 29-year-old married man has been arrested for allegedly raping his 22-year-old sister at knifepoint on two occasions. The victim, blackmailed due to her relationship with another man, endured the assaults in July and August. She bravely contacted the 181 helpline after the second incident, leading to the arrest.

title: 'In Goa, Iranians danced': Chess World Cup returns after 23 yrs; $2m prize at stake
content: Goa is set to host the FIDE World Cup in 2025, marking its return to India after 23 years, reminiscent of the 2002 World Junior Championship where Levon Aronian emerged victorious. The event not only boosted Goa's tourism, particularly attracting Russian visitors, but also showcased the region's hospitality and organisational capabilities.

title: Diamond League Final: Neeraj Chopra finishes second; Weber wins maiden crown
content: Neeraj Chopra secured second place at the Diamond League Final in Zurich, his third consecutive runner-up finish, as Julian Weber of Germany claimed his first title. Weber dominated with a world-leading throw of 91.57m. Chopra's best effort was 85.01m in the final round.

title: Janhvi Kapoor visits Ganpati pandal: Appears visibly uneasy in heavy crowd
content: Janhvi Kapoor and Sidharth Malhotra's film 'Param Sundari' premiered as the actors visited Lalbaugcha Raja. A video showing Janhvi's visible discomfort in the crowded pandal has gone viral, with online users expressing empathy. Early estimates suggest 'Param Sundari' may collect Rs 7–10 crore on its opening day, potentially marking a significant start for both actors.

title: Karnataka: 17-year-old delivers baby in school toilet; staff suspended
content: In a shocking incident in Yadgir, a 17-year-old student at a government residential school gave birth in the school restroom, highlighting severe negligence by the staff. The school principal, warden, and teachers have been suspended for failing to notice the pregnancy or provide necessary care.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in green; BSE Sensex up over 100 points
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, opened in green on Thursday after a sharp decline in the last two trading sessions. While Nifty50 was above 24,500, BSE Sensex was up over 100 points.

title: Udaipur woman delivers 17th child; health dept orders probe
content: A 55-year-old woman in Rajasthan's Udaipur district has delivered her 17th child, raising concerns about population control in the region. The health department has launched an investigation into the case, highlighting the challenges of managing high fertility rates, particularly in tribal areas. The family faces financial difficulties, and officials are focusing on promoting family planning and addressing maternal health risks.

title: Top stocks to buy : Stock recommendations for August 29- check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research suggests Godawari Power and Ispat Limited and Apollo Micro Systems as top stock picks amidst market volatility influenced by new US tariffs. Nifty faces support at 24,400-24,350, while Bank Nifty's key support is at 53,000. Focus remains on quality stocks benefiting from GST reforms and the festive season.

title: Trump tariffs: In a strategic shift, government eyes exports beyond US
content: India is strategically shifting its export focus beyond the US, aiming for diversification due to concerns about over-reliance on specific markets and weaponized supply chains. The government is actively pursuing trade agreements with Europe, exploring opportunities in Africa and CIS countries, and devising strategies for 50 nations to reduce dependence on China and enhance global value chain participation.

title: Taylor Swift vs Ronaldo: Engagement ring showdown — who spent more on love bling?
content: Pop star Taylor Swift and NFL player Travis Kelce got engaged. Swift's ring features an 8-carat diamond. Footballer Cristiano Ronaldo proposed to Georgina Rodríguez. Her ring boasts a 37-carat diamond. Swift's ring is vintage-inspired. Ronaldo's ring is significantly more expensive. Both rings symbolize love and commitment. The rings reflect the couple's personal styles.

title: 3 JeM terrorists slip into Bihar from Nepal: Major changes in Rahul’s yatra plan
content: Bihar is on high alert following intelligence reports of three Pakistani Jaish-e-Mohammed terrorists entering the state via the Nepal border. Security has been heightened in seven border districts, with vehicle checks and surveillance intensified. The alert coincides with Rahul Gandhi's 'Voter Adhikar Yatra,' leading to increased security measures, including a closed vehicle and cancelled roadshow stops.

title: A "Secret" Xi Jinping Letter Was Key To Improved India-China Ties: Report
content: When US President Donald Trump intensified his trade war with China earlier this year, Beijing began an outreach to India with a private letter from President Xi Jinping to President Droupadi Murmu, a Bloomberg report claims.

title: UP Man Married Dead Wife's Sister. Now Wants To Marry Her Younger Sister Too
content: Raj Saxena first got married to a woman in 2021. She, however, died due to a disease a year later, following which he married her sister.

title: US Ends Tariff Exemption On Small Parcels Valued At Or Under $800
content: The United States on Friday ended tariff exemptions on small packages entering the country from abroad, in a move that has sparked concern among small businesses and warnings of consumer price hikes.

title: 'Female Power': Japan Erotic Art Destigmatised In New Exhibit
content: Graphic depictions of enormous phalluses and acrobatic sex positions have long rendered centuries-old Japanese "shunga" art taboo, but a rare exhibition aims to prove the genre is a world apart from male-centred porn.

title: "You're Dark": Techie Who Was Found Dead Was Taunted Over Skin Colour
content: A 27-year-old woman was found dead in south Bengaluru earlier this week, prompting a police investigation into allegations of dowry harassment and domestic abuse.

title: US Okays $825 Million Missile Sale To Ukraine Days After Putin-Trump Meet
content: The Donald Trump administration in the United States has approved a $825 million arms sale to Ukraine that will include extended-range missiles and related equipment to boost its defensive capabilities against Russian aggression.

title: "Coward Took Our Son Away From Us": Father Of 8-Year-Old Killed In Minneapolis Shooting
content: The father of an 8-year-old child killed in a Catholic school shooting in Minneapolis has spoken out in grief, calling the gunman a "coward".

title: What Is A Daruma Doll, The Toy PM Modi Will Receive During His Japan Visit
content: A Daruma doll is a traditional Japanese doll that looks like a round, red, hollow figure with a face but no arms or legs.

title: Congress, BJP Workers Clash In Patna Amid PM Modi Abuse Row
content: BJP and Congress workers clashed on Friday during a protest carried out by the ruling party over the abusive language used againstPM Modi during Rahul Gandhi's rally in poll-bound Bihar.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Using India As A Punching Bag? Not Happening, Mr Trump
content: The Trump administration's tariff decision reflects a broader miscalculation in its belief that India is a softer target than China.

title: Indian-Origin Woman Gets 5 Years Jail For Offering Bribe To Singapore Cops
content: An Indian-origin Singaporean drug abuser, out on bail and remission, was sentenced to an over five years jail for offering a bribe of SGD 1,000 to police officers for allowing her to smoke a cigarette in 2022.

title: Gaza's Nasser Hospital Struck 4 Times During Deadly Israeli Attack: Report
content: Nasser Hospital in southern Gaza was struck at least four times during Israel's deadly attack on Monday, killing 22 people, according to a new analysis by BBC Verify.

title: "Want Closure": Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose's Daughter, 82, To PM Modi On His Remains In Japan
content: It is widely believed that the remains of Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose are held in an urn in a Buddhist temple in Renkoji in Japan.

title: Microsoft Software Engineer, 35, Dies On Silicon Valley Campus
content: Pratik Pandey badged into the office on the evening of August 19 and was found dead in the early hours of the following morning, according to a family member who has spoken with Microsoft and requested anonymity to discuss a personal matter.

title: Fed Governor Lisa Cook Signals 'Clerical Error' May Be Behind Mortgage Dispute
content: Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook's lawyers suggested that an unintentional "clerical error" may have been behind the mortgage dispute over which President Donald Trump wants her fired.

title: Semiconductor Talent Shortfall By 2030, India To Bridge The Gap: Minister
content: The world is projected to face a shortage of one million semiconductor professionals by 2030 and India has the opportunity to bridge a significant part of this gap, according to Minister of Electronics and IT, Ashwini Vaishnaw.

title: "Come Make In India, Make For The World": PM Modi's Pitch In Japan
content: Speaking at the India-Japan Joint Economic Forum in Tokyo today, Prime Minister Narendra issued an invitation: "Come make in India, make for the world."

title: On Camera, Driver Hands Over Bus Control To Helper, Dies An Hour Later
content: A bus driver, driving to Rajasthan from Indore, handed over the steering wheel to the co-driver as soon as he started to feel sick.

title: 6 km In 3 Minutes: Noida Traffic Cops Rush Critical Newborn Twins To Hospital
content: The Noida Traffic Police on Thursday created a 6-km-long green corridor from the DND flyover to the hospital in Sector 30, enabling an ambulance carrying critically newborn twins to cover the stretch in just 3 minutes and 52 seconds, officials said.

title: Four questions in the Micah Parsons trade aftermath: Why in the world would Dallas do this?
content: What are the Cowboys doing? Did they get enough in return? And does Parsons put the Packers at the top of the NFC? Let's sort through this wild trade.

title: A new look in Green Bay: Parsons trade continues Packers' aggressive offseason
content: Signs of change in Green Bay include paying up to trade for Parsons after finally taking a WR in the first round.

title: Parsons traded to Packers, gets record contract
content: Star pass rusher Micah Parsons was traded by the Cowboys to the Packers and agreed to a record contract for a non-quarterback with Green Bay.

title: Jones: Parsons trade will make Cowboys better
content: Cowboys owner Jerry Jones said that trading Micah Parsons to the Packers for Kenny Clark and two draft picks will help Dallas have future playoff success.

title: 'Fun night': Schwarber has MLB's 21st 4-HR game
content: Philadelphia slugger Kyle Schwarber hit four home runs Thursday night against Atlanta to become the fourth Phillies player and 21st major leaguer to accomplish the feat.

title: Gauff fights tears, 8 double faults to grind out win
content: Coco Gauff was broken four times and had seven double faults in the first set but still managed to gut out a 7-6 (5), 6-2 victory over Donna Vekic in the second round of the US Open.

title: Report: Irsay suffered drug relapses before death
content: Former Colts owner Jim Irsay suffered setbacks from a longtime addiction to painkillers before his May death and overdosed at least three times since February 2020, according to The Washington Post.

title: Makhachev-Della Maddalena headlines UFC 322
content: Islam Makhachev will face Jack Della Maddalena in a welterweight title bout at UFC 322 on Nov. 15, while Zhang Weili will move up to challenge flyweight champ Valentina Shevchenko in the co-headliner.

title: Townsend on Open rift: Proud of how I handled it
content: Taylor Townsend said she has gotten support from players after an on-court confrontation with Jelena Ostapenko at the US Open and is proud of how she handled it.

title: LSU's Haulcy to serve first-half ban for '24 fight
content: LSU will play the first half of Saturday's game against Clemson without starting safety A.J. Haulcy, who will serve a suspension for a fight last season while playing for Houston.

title: 👕 AFC East, NFC West reveal 'Rivalries' uniforms
content: Teams from the AFC East and NFC West will don special uniforms during a single home game against a division rival in the 2025 season.

title: We picked X factors for all 32 NFL teams: Who could be a difference-maker this season?
content: What do Ricky Pearsall, Riley Moss, Breece Hall and Rashan Gary have in common? The success of their teams could depend on them.

title: The game is on the line: Which WNBA player gets the last shot?
content: Some thrive in high-pressure situations. Some are the best players, period. Who is that go-to for every team?

title: 25 under 25: Clark, then who? Ranking the best young players
content: Which players have the most future potential? Caitlin Clark, Paige Bueckers and Angel Reese make our list.

title: College football Week 1 preview: Player expectations, freshmen to watch and more
content: Ahead of Week 1, here's what to expect from Jeremiah Smith and Arch Manning, freshmen to watch and notable offseason quotes.

title: Lee Corso's impact felt far beyond 'GameDay' audience
content: The larger-than-life face of college football has touched so many, from fans and players to colleagues and friends.

title: 'He wasn't trying to be anybody else': How Aaron Rodgers won over his Steelers teammates
content: Aaron Rodgers made up for lost offseason time by getting to know his newest teammates. Will it matter?

title: Inside Caleb Williams' 'unapologetic' approach to Year 2 as Bears QB
content: Williams has his flair back as he enters the season with high expectations under new coach Ben Johnson.

title: Inside the rise of the home run robbery: Why baseball's most thrilling play is happening more than ever
content: Nothing brings a crowd to its feet like a homer being taken away. Here's what's powering the rise in outfielder thievery.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Where every team stands as final month approaches
content: As we enter September, every team has something it's focusing on in the final stretch -- ranging from playoff prep to building for next season.

title: Can anyone turn Alcaraz and Sinner's Big Two into a three? Here are 10 candidates
content: Federer and Nadal once seemed set to rule the tennis world. Then Djokovic broke through. Can anyone now join Alcaraz and Sinner's current reign?

title: The best NHL draft pick ever, at every slot from No. 1 to 224
content: Who's the best No. 1 pick? What about No. 27? We analyzed every draft from 1967 to 2025 to find the answers.

title: Mike Clay's Playbook, Part 3: How to manage your team post-draft
content: The draft is just the beginning of the fun. Mike Clay gives you a guide to being a savvy, championship-winning manager.

title: Reaction: Good for Arsenal and Spurs, bad for PSG, must-see games
content: The Champions League is back! So let's unpack all the must-see games, winners and losers, and talking points from Thursday's draw for the 2025-26 League Phase.

title: USMNT countdown to the World Cup: Will Reyna's fresh start save 2026 hopes?
content: Gio Reyna finally has a new club, and if he can rebuild his career in Gladbach, he may yet have a place on the USMNT's 2026 World Cup team.

title: Who has a shot at the championship? Predictions for 2025-26 NBA conference and Finals winners
content: Our final Summer Forecast panel reveals its championship predictions for the East and West conferences and the 2026 NBA Finals.

title: The five stories that explain why Arch Manning was built for this moment
content: How did the Texas quarterback learn to handle the pressure he's facing as the most famous college football player in the country?

title: Why Rashee Rice accepted his six-game suspension now, and how Chiefs will have to cope
content: With the timing and length of Rice's suspension now known, Andy Reid and the offense can plan their season accordingly.

title: Cincinnati's new script helmets headline best college football uniforms from Week 1
content: Cincinnati isn't the only team doing something new for Week 1 -- North Carolina State will be debuting its "City of Oaks" uniform.

title: Ben Shelton and Trinity Rodman relationship timeline
content: The NWSL player playfully challenged the tennis star with a question about his 2nd-round US Open performance.

title: The beginning of the end for Amorim? Man United's shocking loss to fourth-tier Grimsby raises the possibility
content: Ruben Amorim and Manchester United arrived in Grimsby keen to start winning again. Instead, they made history with their latest low point.

title: Instant meme! Man United boss Amorim's tactics board vs. Grimsby goes viral
content: As United lurched into yet another catastrophe, an image of Amorim summed up the club's current situation.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Spurs eye Sancho to replace Son
content: Tottenham Hotspur are considering a move to sign Manchester United winger Jadon Sancho as a replacement for Son Heung-Min. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Dickie V: Preseason All-Rolls Royce teams and Diaper Dandies
content: The best of the best PTPers, including freshmen, who will make you stand up and say, "Are you serious, baby?!"

title: A contract, designer wardrobe and UFC win: Inside Baisangur Susurkaev's best week
content: Baisangur Susurkaev entered the week of Aug. 12 unknown and ended it Dana White's "favorite fighter."

title: Way-too-early UFC at the White House fight card
content: Let's take an early look at a UFC event at the White House in 2026 that Dana White says is "going to happen."

title: Political discourse is turning toxic, violent; parties must stick to their principles: Mayawati
content: Mayawati also took strong exception to "derogatory, indecent and unparliamentary" remarks being made publicly about people holding high positions in government and non-government institutions, and politics

title: Eight injured in fire triggered by cylinder explosion in Badami in Karnataka
content: Officials was found that the shop-owners had illegally stocked two 14-kg LPG cylinders and 20 5-kg LPG cylinders in their cycle shop

title: Bihar SIR: SC agrees to hear RJD, CPI(ML)’s plea to extend deadline for filing claims to September 15
content: RJD claims Aadhaar is not being received by BLOs as a ‘standalone’ document, even after August 22 order

title: RJD, AIMIM move Supreme Court seeking extension of September 1 deadline for claim filing in Bihar SIR
content: Advocate Nizam Pasha, appearing for the AIMIM, said time needs to be extended due to large scale filing of claims and objections

title: T.N. illegal kidney sale racket: Madras High Court orders inquiry by Health Secretary
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh passes order after Dhanalakshmi Srinivasan Medical College and Hospital in Perambalur challenges cancellation of its renal transplant licence

title: The August 2000 deluge that Hyderabad forgot
content: On August 23, 2000 it began to rain after a cyclonic circulation crossed the Bay of Bengal coast at Kakinada. It brought a week of woe to a rapidly-urbanising Hyderabad.

title: Qatar wants to negotiate trade pact with India: Goyal
content: India's share in global trade is only about 2%, and about 40% of items of the total exports to the U.S. are out of the ambit of 50% tariffs

title: In India, capital does not just grow, it multiplies: PM Modi in Tokyo
content: Narendra Modi addressed the India-Japan Economic Forum, where he said that India is the "springboard" for Japanese business to the Global South

title: Elgar Parishad case: Supreme Court to hear bail plea of Surendra Gadling on September 3
content: A bench comprising Chief Justice B.R. Gavai and justices N.V. Anjaria and Alok Aradhe was apprised that on August 26 Justice M M Sundresh recused himself from hearing the bail plea

title: India has turned into ‘oil money laundromat for Kremlin’: White House trade adviser Peter Navarro
content: "If India, the world's largest democracy, wants to be treated like a strategic partner of the U.S., it needs to act like one," Peter Navarro said, putting out a series of social media posts attacking New Delhi

title: Madras High Court allows appeal filed by Edappadi K. Palaniswami in AIADMK leadership dispute case
content: Justices Anita Sumanth and N. Senthilkumar set aside permission granted by a single judge in 2022 to two individuals to file a suit, against AIADMK bylaws, in representative capacity

title: Supreme Court issues notice to Centre on plea to declare ‘Ram Setu’ national monument
content: Dr. Swamy had raised the issue of declaring Ram Setu as a national monument in his PIL against the controversial Sethusamudram Ship Channel project, initiated by the UPA-I government

title: Issue censor certificate to Tamil movie Manushi after necessary cuts: Madras High Court
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh issues the direction to Central Board of Film Certification after watching the movie at a private screening

title: Heavy rains hit Uttarakhand; several people trapped, houses damaged in landslips
content: Incessant rain and landslides in Basukedaar area of Rudraprayag district have caused heavy damage in more than half a dozen villages, officials said

title: Bihar announces scheme to provide financial aid to women for starting employment venture
content: The Chief Minister said a proposal in this regard was approved at a cabinet meeting earlier in the day

title: Amit Shah to launch BJP’s 2026 Assam poll campaign through panchayat leaders’ convention
content: The Home Minister is scheduled to attend a programme to celebrate the birth centenary of the State’s first non-Congress Chief Minister

title: Karnataka: Rain havoc leads to waterlogging, traffic congestion in Bengaluru on August 28
content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecast a generally cloudy sky with one or two spells of rain or thundershowers for August 29

title: Karnataka rain: Crops on over 61,000 hectares lost to heavy rainfall, floods in Belagavi district
content: Deputy Commissioner Mohammad Roshan said the joint survey will begin after the rains stop and due compensation will be paid to farmers as per government norms

title: Police arrest man for abusive language against PM Modi during Voter Adhikar Yatra; Amit Shah demands apology from Rahul Gandhi
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar on Friday, August 29, condemned the alleged abuses hurled at Prime Minister Narendra Modi during Rahul Gandhi’s ‘Voter Adhikar Yatra’ in the state

title: NRI lauded by Pawan Kalyan for writing book on A.P. politics
content: A U.S. returned youngster Vineel Vishwambhara Dutt Syed has written a book titled ‘A Millennial’s Take on Andhra Politics’

title: Theatre director Deepan Sivaraman on Ibsen’s ‘Peer Gynt’ adaptation to be staged at Alexandrinsky Theatre Festival in Russia
content: The adaptation of the Norwegian classic premiered in 2011, and derives inspiration from the pandemic and other geo-political events

title: Justices Alok Aradhe and Vipul M. Pancholi sworn in as Supreme Court Judges
content: With the swearing-in of these two judges, the Supreme Court returned to its full sanctioned judicial strength of 34

title: DGCA grants 6-month extension to IndiGo for operating leased Turkish Airlines planes
content: Sources said the DGCA has given a six-month extension to operate the two aircraft from Turkish Airlines on "wet/damp lease" till February 28, 2026

title: India rain LIVE updates: Cloudburst, landslips in Uttarakhand; five dead, many families buried under rubble
content: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami in a post on X said, “I am constantly in touch with the officials in this regard, I have spoken to the Disaster Secretary and District Magistrates and given necessary instructions for effective conduct of rescue operations.”

title: Railway reason behind Mizoram’s anti-begging Bill
content: Social Welfare Minister Lalrinpuii stated that the government had weighed the possibility of beggars from outside arriving by train

title: Punjab floods: CM Mann says monitoring ‘natural disaster’, Congress terms it ‘man-made’
content: Describing the situation in Amritsar as “unprecedented”, Bhagwant Mann assured all possible assistance from his government, adding that the State has already started massive relief and rescue work

title: Fantasy baseball news: White Sox place Robert on IL; Brewers shuffle pitching staff
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . there are only eight games on today's ledger, with five matinees and three evening affairs . the red sox will activate Rob Refsnyder from the 10-day IL in advance of this afternoon's contest .

title: BRO clears Pir Panjal roads in J&K’s Rajouri after landslips; IMD issue alerts
content: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued weather warnings for the region. A yellow alert has been sounded for Friday in Poonch, Reasi, Rajouri, Kishtwar, and Udhampur districts, forecasting thunderstorms and lightning

title: Of an adoption maze and a menace thriving in its shadow
content: Long waiting period, extreme emotional strain and excessive bureaucracy make many prospective adoptive parents avoid adoption via government channels and resort to illegal alternatives. Simplifying the process without watering down safeguards could pave the way for many a desperate couple find their bundle of joy and curb a heinous criminal activity that plays with lives

title: Hyderabad knows its flood map but still drowns
content: Twenty-five years after the big flood of 2000, Hyderabad continues to live on the edge of disaster. The city has long known its flood map, its gradient and its vulnerabilities. Yet, little has changed on ground. Reports gather dust, lakes vanish under concrete and warnings remain unheeded even as the downpour of August 7 this year offered yet another reminder of this dangerous complacency

title: Heavy rains in Himachal Pradesh disrupt 524 roads, 1230 electricity transformers hit
content: Himachal Pradesh has suffered 312 deaths since the onset of the monsoon on June 20, with 160 fatalities linked to rain-related disasters

title: Four teenagers drown in Dumka’s Mayurakshi river, one body recovered: Police
content: A senior police official said that an NDRF team from Deoghar has been requisitioned to help the district administration in searching for the bodies of other students

title: NHRC chief calls for stronger monitoring mechanisms to stop ragging on campuses
content: NHRC Chairperson V. Ramasubramanian ‘expressed concern’ over the prevailing practice of ragging in higher educational institutions

title: Maratha quota protest: Manoj Jarange begins hunger strike at Azad Maidan, traffic hit across Mumbai
content: The 43-year-old activist received a rousing welcome from thousands of supporters, sporting saffron caps, scarves and flags, after he reached the protest venue

title:
When two departments of Tamil Nadu government turn ‘in-laws’ at 
Vriddachalam temple festival
content: A custom that is believed to have originated during the British period more than a century ago is still being followed at the temple of Lord Viruthagireeswarar and Goddess Viruthambigai. Officials of the two departments conduct Thirukalyanam in the Tamil Month of Aadi. In the invitation, their names are mentioned as those inviting the guests.

title: Thiruvathigai, where temple vahanas and chariots are crafted in Tamil Nadu
content:
Thiruvathigai, where Saint Thirunavukkarasar, once a Jain, was cured of a stomach ailment and embraced Saivism, is
also renowned for skilled artisans who craft temple vahanas and cars. They carry on the tradition for generations

title:
How the number of electors went up
and down over the years in the State
content:
The deletion of 65 lakh electors from Bihar’s draft electoral rolls has kicked up a row nationwide. In Tamil Nadu, the decline in the size of the electorate lasted between 1999 and 2009. In fact, in 2009, when the State faced the Lok Sabha election, close to 50 
lakh names were dropped from the rolls. Yet, the deletion largely went unnoticed

title: ‘Past mistakes’ cannot be an excuse for land swap deal, says TTD former Chairman Bhumana
content: Bhumana urges the government to rectify ‘the mistakes during the YSRCP’s tenure if any’, instead of launching a tirade against the party and its president

title: A.P CM to arrive in Chittoor on a two-day visit
content: Naidu is scheduled to release water from Kuppam branch canal of the Handri Neeva Sujala Sravanthi project on August 30

title: Two women, youth held for ‘murdering’ moneylender in Prakasam district
content: With the woman moneylender pestering the accused to clear the loans, they smothered her to death and fled with valuables worth ₹3 lakh from the house, say police

title: Apple’s retail expansion in India comes amid strained trade ties between New Delhi and Washington
content: The Cupertino-based company’s sequence of openings in India, from financial and political capitals first, followed by Bengaluru and Pune centres, suggests Apple wants more than transactional sales

title: In India’s development journey, Japan has always been an important partner, says PM Modi | LIVE
content: Addressing the India-Japan Joint Economic Forum, PM Narendra Modi said that India is a springboard for Japanese businesses to the Global South

title: Sangh will not participate in movements for Mathura & Kashi, but it won’t stop Swayamsewaks, says Mohan Bhagwat
content: Speaking on Manusmriti, RSS chief urged religious leaders to come up with ‘smriti’ that is appropriate for present times

title: PM Modi arrives in Japan on two-day visit
content: In his departure statement, Prime Minister Modi said his visit to Japan will be an opportunity to strengthen civilisational bonds and cultural ties between the two countries

title: Justice Tirthankar Ghosh of Calcutta High Court escapes from hearing R.G. Kar incident petition by victim’s parents
content: Speaking about the RG Kar incident TMC’s Abhishek Banerjee claimed that the Kolkata Police was more effective in finding the perpetrator than the central government’s CBI

title: 2015 Ambur riots case: 22 convicted; 26 police personnel to get compensation
content: The Judge observed that the cost of compensation paid by the State government to the victims could be recovered by attaching properties of late A. Aslam Basha, the then MLA for Ambur constituency, who was also a suspect in the case

title: ​​Calcutta University holds scheduled exams on founding day of​ TMC students’ wing despite pressure for postponement
content: Nearly 30,000 students from over 150 colleges under the university are said to have appeared for the exams

title: The people of Bihar want to oust NDA, voter rights rally has become a lifeline: K.C. Venugopal
content: Congress general secretary (organisation) says any talk about infiltrators is the typical polarisation bogey of the BJP to divert the attention of voters from real issues; INDIA bloc’s fight against ‘vote theft’ has become a public movement in Bihar, he says

title: Freed from bondage after a decade, tribal labourers in Odisha travel back home on foot
content: For ten years, the tribal man was forced to toil in a brick kiln like a captive, occasionally allowed to visit home only on the condition that another family would remain as collateral hostage

title: Rajasthan becomes first State to issue guidelines on stray dogs after Supreme Court directive
content: The Supreme Court’s ruling pertained to the control of stray canine population in the National Capital Region.

title: RTA told to take steps to increase time gap between private buses
content: High Court says relying on policemen to regulate traffic flow could be tried out instead of signal lights

title: Questions in Justice Nagarathna’s dissent remain even as Justices Aradhe, Pancholi to be sworn in as Supreme Court judges on August 29
content: The lone woman apex court judge’s questions in her dissent included the reasons behind the transfer of Justice Pancholi from Gujarat to Patna in July 2023

title: Bihar police officers to get ₹1.50 crore insurance in case of death on duty
content: In June 2025, a speeding SUV had killed female constable Komal Kumari on Atal Path in Patna during a vehicle checking drive. She is the first police officer to get the insurance amount of ₹1.5 crore in the police department.

title: VIT Chennai signs 7 MoUs and patent commercialisation agreement at industry-academia summit
content: Themed ‘Smart Mobility, Sustainable Manufacturing, and Automation for a Resilient Future’, the two-day conclave brought together 48 industry experts, over 140 industry participants, and 55 academicians

title: Bengaluru Suburban Railway Project: A dream derailed
content: Touted as the third pillar of public transport after BMTC and Namma Metro, the ambitious Bengaluru Suburban Railway Project is mired in delays, contractor exits, and land acquisition hurdles, finds Darshan Devaiah B. P.

title: Telangana explains KWDT-II on how water drawal from Nagarjunasagar to Andhra enhanced
content: Senior counsel C.S. Vaidyanathan presents arguments for Telangana on the decisions taken detrimental to it by AP

title: Jammu and Kashmir High Court grants U.T. government 20 days to submit final stand on Gulmarg lease issue
content: Dozens of hoteliers are unable to extend their lease period after the Lt.-Governor’s administration replaced the rules for lease with a new one in 2022

title: DPR study on extending Kochi metro to Angamaly begins
content: The study marks the beginning of the fulfilment of the long-pending demand to connect the metro to the international airport and extend it further to Angamaly, says KMRL managing director

title: Entire village in Bihar shown residing in one house, claims Rahul
content: The Congress' post on X said that in Nidani village of Gaya district, under Barachatti assembly segment, "all 947 voters" of a booth have been shown to be "residents of house number six".

title: CPI(M), UDF lock horns over protests against Shafi Parambil in Kozhikode
content: DYFI alleges that MP is ‘protecting’ Mamkootathil; UDF views the protests as a direct attack on Shafi who trounced CPI(M) veteran K.K. Shailaja in its stronghold Vadakara in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls

title: Kozhikode MCH to procure surgical devices amid shortage in Cardiology dept.
content: The issue arose after distributors of these devices stopped supplies, citing pending dues worth hundreds of crores

title: Kamareddy flood | Moisture from Bay of Bengal and wind from Arabian Sea brought deluge: IMD scientist
content: We put out a red alert at 10 a.m. on August 27. The red alert has been there for the past 30 hours and the total rainfall is now 65 cm., says IMD scientist

title: Pre-test for Census 2027 to be conducted in October-November
content: Pre-test will only include questions from the first phase; to evaluate data collection methodologies, logistics, mobile app and other digital tools, identify potential issues on the field, Registrar General and Census Commissioner tells State Directorates of Census Operations

title: Water levels begin to recede as J&K battles flood impact
content: CM directs officials to restore transportation and electricity in all affected areas; Jammu-Srinagar NH still out of bounds for traffic, schools across Jammu division to remain closed till August 30

title: Graziano: Don't be surprised if these 32 things happen
content: we are back for our annual edition of preseason surprise predictions . one for each of the 32 teams ahead of the 2025 season . we hit potential stat leaders, under-the-radar teams, award candidates, sleeper players to watch .

title: Draft Guide: Rankings, mock drafts and analysis
content: this draft guide will serve as a one-stop shop for all of our best material . your league, your rules Create a league and customize league size, scoring and rules to play . if you play in a redraft league, an intense deep dynasty format or anything in between, we at ESPN Fantasy are here to help .

title: How Kelce has prepared for what could be his final season
content: the Chiefs star tight end is in the final year of his contract . he has spoken about his future with the team through only this season . "i can't go out like that," he says . the chiefs start their season in so Paulo next week .

title: East Carolina-NC State and other under-the-radar rivalries really pack a punch
content: a referee sustaining a cut beneath an eye . he was riding a shotgun, dressed head-to-toe in north Carolina state red and white . his brother was in the backseat, donned in east Carolina purple and gold .

title: The Playoff Playbook: Tips to help you win your fantasy baseball league
content: the fantasy baseball playoffs begin on Monday in the rotisserie leagues . it's formally make-or-break, win or go-home time, where the stakes are heightened each and every day . you're not in much different circumstances, with a mad, four-week dash to the finish line ahead .

title: PLL semifinals: Quint Kessenich's keys to Waterdogs-Atlas, Redwoods-Outlaws
content: the final four of the 2025 premier lacrosse league playoffs is set . in the east, the Philadelphia Waterdogs take on the New York Atlas For the West half of the bracket . the four clubs descend on Subaru Park outside of Philadelphia on Monday for the semifinals .

title: NWSL transfer grades: Amid world-record fee and USWNT hopefuls, which moves were best?
content: the transfer window is officially closed for new summer arrivals in the NWSL . Lizbeth Jacqueline Ovalle set the new women's global transfer record at $1.5 million . but there have been several other high-profile transfers involving NWSL players .

title: Contenders and bottom five: Expert predictions for NBA East and West standings
content: in a competitive Western Conference, standings don't seem as set in stone . last season, seeding for the playoffs wasn't settled until the last day of the regular season . this season, after some major moves, most notably Kevin Durant to the Houston Rockets, expect to see another tense standings race .
